key_points: Hurricane Ida's impact included damaging John Schneider’s studios in Holden, Louisiana, affecting two iconic General Lee cars from 'The Dukes of Hazzard'.
One of the General Lee cars was crushed by the storm, and another was found stuck in a tree.
Actor John Schneider, who played Bo Duke in the series, chooses to react with laughter despite the damages.
The General Lee car has sparked controversy for featuring the Confederate flag and being named after Civil War General Robert E. Lee.
TV Land and Warner Bros. responded to controversy by ceasing reruns of the show and stopping production of General Lee toy cars in 2015.
Schneider defended the General Lee in an interview, stating it never caused issues with African American fans and emphasized the unifying nature of the show.
According to Schneider, the show’s characterization as divisive is unfair and might impact its legacy.
Schneider actively participates in hurricane relief efforts in Tennessee and encourages support for those affected by natural disasters.
He requests help for the damaged studios through his studio’s website.
Donations for broader hurricane relief efforts are suggested to be made to the United Way of Southeast Louisiana or the Red Cross.
spokespersons: John Schneider (Actor, played Bo Duke in 'The Dukes of Hazzard')
